summary: This document is an email chain from October 2019 between financial investigators discussing potential asset forfeiture strategies related to Jeffrey Epstein. It focuses on a property linked to Ghislaine Maxwell, suggesting Epstein wired her money and that she is listed on the deed, with a Citibank mortgage. The investigators consider subpoenaing bank records to trace if Epstein's funds were used to purchase the property.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the investigation; the email discusses tracing his money, particularly wires to Ghislaine Maxwell, and potential forfeiture of property linked to him.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Property owner and recipient of funds
persons.context: Identified as the grantor and grantee on a deed for a property of interest. The email notes FinCEN hits showing Epstein wired her money and discusses if Epstein's money funded the property.

connections.description: Epstein is identified as having wired money to Maxwell, and investigators are examining if his funds were used to purchase a property under her name.

events.title: Discussion of asset forfeiture strategy
events.description: An email raises the question of whether the SDNY would consider forfeiture of Epstein's property not just for 'facilitation' of crimes but also as proceeds from those crimes.

events.title: Identification of property and financial link
events.description: An email details FinCEN hits showing Epstein wired money to Ghislaine Maxwell and notes she is listed on the deed for a property with a Citibank mortgage, prompting consideration of a subpoena for mortgage records.

locations: Property linked to Ghislaine Maxwell (specific address not given in text)
keyFacts: Investigators were actively considering asset forfeiture of property linked to Jeffrey Epstein in October 2019, exploring grounds beyond 'facilitation' of crimes to include property as 'proceeds' of crimes.
Ghislaine Maxwell is identified as both the 'Grantor' and 'Grantee' on the deed for a property of interest, which had a Citibank mortgage.
Financial records (FinCEN hits) showed Jeffrey Epstein had wired money to Ghislaine Maxwell.
The investigation involved subpoenaing or planning to subpoena records from Citibank to determine if Epstein's money was used to fund the property in Maxwell's name.
The document is a sensitive internal email containing BSA (Bank Secrecy Act) information, highlighting the financial investigative angle of the Epstein case.
